question: Create a monthly budget for a recent college graduate with their first full-time job

expenses.name: Rent
expenses.feedback: Housing should typically be no more than 30% of your income. Consider roommates to reduce costs.

expenses.name: Utilities
expenses.feedback: Be energy-conscious to keep these costs down.

expenses.name: Groceries
expenses.feedback: Meal planning and cooking at home can significantly reduce food expenses.

expenses.name: Transportation
expenses.feedback: Consider public transportation or carpooling to save money.

expenses.name: Student Loan Payment
expenses.feedback: Always pay at least the minimum on student loans to avoid penalties.

expenses.name: Entertainment
expenses.feedback: Look for free or low-cost entertainment options to reduce this expense.

expenses.name: Dining Out
expenses.feedback: Limiting dining out can be one of the easiest ways to save money.

expenses.name: Savings
expenses.feedback: Aim to save at least 15% of your income for emergencies and future goals.

expenses.name: Gym Membership
expenses.feedback: Consider free exercise alternatives or negotiate for a better rate.

question: Create a budget for a family of four with one working parent

expenses.name: Mortgage
expenses.feedback: Housing costs are typically the largest expense for families.

expenses.name: Utilities
expenses.feedback: Energy-efficient appliances and habits can reduce these costs.

expenses.name: Groceries
expenses.feedback: Buying in bulk and planning meals can help reduce food costs for larger families.

expenses.name: Car Payment
expenses.feedback: Consider if a less expensive vehicle might meet your needs.

expenses.name: Insurance (Health, Auto, Home)
expenses.feedback: Shop around annually to ensure you're getting the best rates.

expenses.name: Childcare
expenses.feedback: Look into flexible spending accounts or tax credits to offset these costs.

expenses.name: Entertainment & Activities
expenses.feedback: Look for family-friendly free events in your community.

expenses.name: Dining Out
expenses.feedback: Limit restaurant meals to special occasions to save money.

expenses.name: Clothes & Personal Items
expenses.feedback: Consider secondhand stores for growing children.

expenses.name: Savings
expenses.feedback: Even small amounts of savings can add up over time.
